text: Quick HubSpot Security question: is TLS1.0 disabled for the HubSpot servers?
pretty sure. <@U6MHBFW1K>?
<@U25C6PU56> you mean for <http://app.HubSpot.com|app.HubSpot.com>, or for HubSpot-hosted sites?
Should be for HubSpot-hosted sites
I have an IT guy for a client asking in relation to migrating their current PHP site to a HubSpot Portal to be hosted
It’s enabled by default for HubSpot-hosted sites, but I can set a minimum TLS version on request. We plan to add that to settings at some point, too.

To be clear, <http://app.HubSpot.com|app.HubSpot.com> is just the HubSpot interface (the connection from your computer to the HubSpot tool) which is NOT the clients published (e.g. public) HubSpot-hosted website. Correct?
right, they’re configured differently
Ok, great. How would one submit such a custom request if I needed to
Feel free to DM me if needed as well

typically through support, but if you send me the domain name and minimum TLS version I can set it for you. 

Do you have access to their portal? Just for prudence, I don’t want to let you tweak settings for a portal you don’t have admin access to.
Just want to know the best way to handle it
I do have access, I need to ask them what they want though
I’ll get back to you on Slack if that’s ok
okay

Just an FYI for anyone else who has this question, there's a short blurb on <http://HubSpot.com/security|HubSpot.com/security> that covers this:

```Encryption Options: By default, customer websites using HTTPS are configured to allow TLS 1.0, 1.1, and
1.2. It is possible to remove support for one or more of these algorithms. Customers may also opt into
enabling HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) for their HubSpot-hosted domain. To make these changes,
please contact HubSpot Support or your Customer Success Manager.```
Thanks <@U22PU4G4A>!!Very helpful!
Your welcome.
Is there a way to force a download from the file manager? I know in dropbox you can do something like `?dl=1` at the end to force, does HS have anything like this?
not that i know of. But you could always use the `download` attribute on your link
do you any docs on the attribute or an example?
<https://davidwalsh.name/download-attribute>
I believe you need to use the same origin domain or you may run into issues in certain browsers
You can zip the file and it will automatically pop a download

True, we have client who is looking to have a product image gallery and was going to link the files like jpg, eps, and more. I suggested the zip route as a better way but was also curious on just doing a regular dl link
What plugin do y'all recommend for making a modal popup?
I recommend popping with Magnific Popup
I use the download attribute as well.
Thanks Chad, I actually found your blog post about it on the Blueleadz site. But it's 3 year old lol. wanted to get some opinions
Yes that should be updated but the jist is still the same. We use magnific popup cause it is simple and just works.
perfect, that's what I need, thanks
<http://dimsemenov.com/plugins/magnific-popup/>
Magnific Popup is great. Pretty much the only one I've ever used that I didn't hate.
we've used fancybox for alot of the sites we've done: <http://fancyapps.com/fancybox/3/>

<< "Back to Blog" button should REALLY go back to the blog from which you created the post... I'm getting #mildyinfuriated of landing on the "all blogs" page when I finish creating a post in a specific blog :X
Anyone know if when you enable the support form on your site through service hub, is this something that is automatically thrown on all pages or do you have control via the embed?
right now you just get a page that you send people to
we elected to create our own form because as of when we checked last week, we couldn't add custom fields.
Plus, we wanted custom notifications.
since workflows can create tickets, it wasn't hard to just create a form and notification/ticket creation workflows
